trans-unit.source: Locks the specified file for exclusive access by the calling process

seg-source.mrk: Locks the specified file for exclusive access by the calling process

target.mrk: Locks the specified file for exclusive access by the calling process

trans-unit.source: The starting byte offset in the file where the lock should begin.

seg-source.mrk: The starting byte offset in the file where the lock should begin.

target.mrk: The starting byte offset in the file where the lock should begin.

trans-unit.source: The length of the byte range to be locked.

seg-source.mrk: The length of the byte range to be locked.

target.mrk: The length of the byte range to be locked.

trans-unit.source: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

seg-source.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

target.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

trans-unit.source: If a process terminates with a portion of a file locked or closes a file that has outstanding locks, the locks are

seg-source.mrk: If a process terminates with a portion of a file locked or closes a file that has outstanding locks, the locks are

target.mrk: If a process terminates with a portion of a file locked or closes a file that has outstanding locks, the locks are

trans-unit.source: unlocked by the operating system. However, the time it takes for the operating system to unlock these locks depends

seg-source.mrk: However, the time it takes for the operating system to unlock these locks depends

target.mrk: However, the time it takes for the operating system to unlock these locks depends

trans-unit.source: upon available system resources. Therefore, it is recommended that your process explicitly unlock all files it

seg-source.mrk: Therefore, it is recommended that your process explicitly unlock all files it

target.mrk: Therefore, it is recommended that your process explicitly unlock all files it
